## assert() function

Asserts that the condition is of a specific type. Throw an error if the condition fails. Also known as `invariant`<!-- -->.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function assert<T>(condition: T | null | undefined, message?: string | (() => string)): asserts condition is T;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  condition | T \| null \| undefined | A value of any type to assert by mean of truthy coercion. |
|  message | string \| (() =&gt; string) | An optional message to customize the assertion failure message. It could be a simple string or a lazy string for cases where the message takes a fair amount of effort to compute. |

<b>Returns:</b>

asserts condition is T

void

## Exceptions

Throws if the condition is not truthy, with either a default message or a customized one if provided
